revised_title: A Water-Level Apparatus for Accurate Sea Observations
tldr: Charles Leigh presents a water-level apparatus that can be fixed to Davis's Quadrant, allowing accurate sea observations even in thick and hazy weather. The device relies on the principle that the surface of liquids, when free from external causes, will be in a horizontal plane. This invention aims to prevent shipwrecks and loss of cargo due to inaccurate observations in unfavorable weather conditions.
